website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus M.Zuiko Digital ED 45mm f1.8 is compact, sharp, and can capture a ton of lightâ€”it's a great portrait lens for Micro Four Thirds cameras.

customer_reviews.title: It's one of the best and lowest cost legit AF Portrait lenses available!
customer_reviews.text: People always scream that micro four thirds doesn't do shallow depth of field. BULLCRAP! Just look at my images! The images are fine and my clients love my work! This lens was the missing link in my cache. This will allow me to grab pro level images with shallow depth of field or in low light when it counts! The auto focus is ULTRA fast and accurate on my Panasonic G7 and even faster on my Panasonic GH5 ( I'm talking stills). This would be the perfect lens if it only had weather sealing but that's the trade off for only $349. (Amazon payments is sweet!)
customer_reviews.author: D. GriffinTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: An absolute must have for any pro m43 kit
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this lens. Equivalent to a 90mm field of view with gorgeous shallow depth of field. Small and compact. I use this lens for event work and interviews as well as detail shots/b-roll. Very versatile for a prime. Creamy natural bokeh offers excellent separation of subject from background. An absolute must have for any professional kit. Performance and quality far exceeds the modest price. One of the best value m43 lenses available. I use this lens on every shoot multiple times. My favorite prime, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bazala

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portraits!
customer_reviews.text: I had a kamlan f1.1 lense before this that I tried to do portraits with, but the focus was never just right, and the lense was just too soft in almost any lighting. This was the perfect fit for my portraits though. I wish I had gone for this first instead of chasing a crazy f-stop number.
customer_reviews.author: mountaindew267

customer_reviews.title: I've got the 25mm Panasonic lens as well and they match wonderfully. My background is primarily broadcast video and I ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a very sharp image! I've got the 25mm Panasonic lens as well and they match wonderfully. My background is primarily broadcast video and I use this lens for that. It's turned out great images when doing interviews. The colors come out very nice not too much contrast just right. It does a great job in low light as would be expected at f 1.8. I got mine used but no issues with performance or aesthetics. If you are a micro four thirds video shooter I would say this is a must have for a nice sharp image.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Reader

customer_reviews.title: Lovely sweet portrait lens.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting edge (and relatively affordable) lenses like the Oly/Zuiko 45mm might be the biggest reason to own a Micro-four-thirds camera. This 45mm lens is comparable to a 90mm lens on a full frame 35mm camera. So it is a wonderful portrait lens, great indoors and outdoors. This lens is tack sharp across the full frame. Depth of field is wonderfully shallow so your background and foreground just disappear into a silky softness. Put this lens on an Olympus OM-D or Panasonic G3 or GH2, and your images will beat the pants off mid-level APS-C DSLRs and, hard to believe, go toe to toe with the last-generation full frame DSLRs (i.e. the Canon 5d Mk2).
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: One of the best "bang for buck" lenses you can buy for Micro 4/3 cameras
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned this lens wouldn't perform so well as I have a Panasonic and image stabilization for the lens only works on olympus bodies. Well as long as there is adequate light or a tripod the photos are tac sharp and give larger DSLR's and their lenses a run for their money. It's really that good.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto123

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Was able to save a considerable sum by buying USED instead of new. Cannot tell that the lens is used--it was in that good of a condition.
customer_reviews.author: Zander

customer_reviews.title: my favorite lens!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this lens for a day and it is already my favorite. I was concerned that the autofocus wouldn't work as well, but it does. I absolutely love the pictures it produces with no effort - so professional looking!
customer_reviews.author: BookcaseLaura

customer_reviews.title: Low-light wonder!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous lens. Lots of glass - it sucks in the light and makes low-light photography much easier. The 90-mm (35-mm-equivalent) focal length is great for portraits, or for getting closer to the action in poorly-lit venues. This quickly became a favorite lens.
customer_reviews.author: tip184

customer_reviews.title: For the focal range in MF3, a must have...
customer_reviews.text: Just as all reviews have stated, very optically clear, precise, detailed. For this focal range a must have for micro four thirds. Very small, inconspicuous, with great image quality. Very well built. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: chris d williamsTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A useful focal length and worth the price.  Not a deluxe finish but optics are fine.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good for the price. A little stiff mounting but not overly so. 37mm is a small screw in size for filters. Decoration ring slides off rather easily and not sure of its purpose actually. I am ordering a rubber folding screw on hood for the lens. The focal length is a useful one and the tiny size makes nice company for a small mirrorless model by Oly or Panasonic. Kind of toy like feel but optics do the job and that is what counts.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Siegel

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens to work with a DJI Inspire 2. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Portraits!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Canon 5D II user for years. I wanted to downsize for travelling. I went with the Olympus OM-D EM5. My kit would not be complete without a prime lens for portraits. This is the one! The lens is small, fast and well-built. Colors are beautiful, and one can achieve a beautiful bokeh. For those who really prefer prime lenses, this is must-have in the Micro 4/3 photographer's bag. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvana

customer_reviews.title: What a fun lens.
customer_reviews.text: If you're reading this review, you probably already know this lens is great. Just go ahead and buy it. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexism

customer_reviews.title: Great portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a couple of years. It has never taken a bad picture. For spur of the moment shots you do need to take a few steps back as it is fixed, but for planned people shots, it is fantastic. I just want an affordable quality zoom lens now
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great lens. Great price. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing- everyone says it. Worth the purchase. Great low light. Great portraits. Here's pic from our Church Christmas Eve service. Taken with Oly EPL5
customer_reviews.author: Hot Sweet Donuts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: Its my first choice for family portraits. Very compact, lightweight and sharp. I wish it focused a bit closer like the Panasonic 42.5 f1.7, but its not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: dipus

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Prime for MFT
customer_reviews.text: Equivalent to 90mm on film camera. Good for portraits and short telephoto. Not a macro. AF is fast and lens is sharp. Another "must have" for the enthusiast building an MFT system with prime lenses instead of zooms. Recessed red dot helps to visually align lens for placement on camera body. Too bad Olympus didn't design like Panasonic MFT lenses that have a raised red dot for visual and tactile (parfticularly in the dark) reference.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Lau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Was a perfect purchase. The lens is nice, small, light, and compact. The 1.8 aperture takes great photos and even greater video! One thing wasn't too sure of when I purchased it was: whether or not it took HD video and the answer is YES. This lens does HD video! And it can continuously focus whilst filming, also. It's very quick, sharp, and most importantly, silent! I bought this for $249 because of the special rebate offer. ***BE AWARE! For a short while, Olympus is offering a mail-in rebate for $150! Go on geddit!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portrait lens for Micro four thirds.
customer_reviews.text: This lens produces awesome quality portraits for micro four thirds cameras. I have tired it on an olympus EPL5 and Panasonic GH3. If you want to get the best portraits possible on micro four thirds cameras you need this lens and/or the 75mm 1.8. This lens is much cheaper than the 75mm and has a focal range that is easier to work with (although the 75mm is king). I think this lens at it's price/size is a lens every micro four thirds user needs. I don't understand how someone can give this less than 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: gatorheadLuis

customer_reviews.title: A M4/3 must have
customer_reviews.text: The Olympus 45mm is a brilliant lens. It's sharp, some call it clinically sharp and I wouldn't argue with them. I found it to be sharp wide open at f/1.8. And wide open, it produces nice bokeh. The color reproduction seems accurate, and in a way this lens just sort of gets out of your way. It gets things right, the color, bokeh, sharpness, AF speed, size, and price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: ... new to drone videography but this lens is really nice. its such a treat to get a tele ...
customer_reviews.text: i'm still new to drone videography but this lens is really nice. its such a treat to get a tele look vice a 15mm standard lens on the DJI Inspire 2
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Olympus 45mm F1.8 micro 4/3
customer_reviews.text: This lens has received great reviews everywhere on the net for a good reason. It is small, light and takes breathtakenly sharp photos from edge to edge from F4 on. You can get very nice bokeh and colors are rich and saturated. For a portrait lens you cannot get much better and it is also a great take everywhere lens too and is mighty fast at F1.8. A must have for micro 4/3 cameras!
customer_reviews.author: Ranchibi

customer_reviews.title: Sharp even at 1.8
customer_reviews.text: Long time Sony user (A77) recently bought a epl1 to take use of my collection of vintage lenses that were not adaptable to my Sony. Since then I've sold all my Sony equipment to get a GH2. I wanted a good AF portrait lens so decided to give this a try. It literally puts sony 50mm 1.8 to shame. It's sharp all the way open, geourgous coloring, and silent focus. I literally LOVE this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Optics are superb (at least, to me). Cost benefit hardly insuperable.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Bertens

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect with Inspire 2 X5S Camera
customer_reviews.text: Fly this on my inspire 2 daily for work. Works perfectly with the X5S camera.
customer_reviews.author: Inspireflyer

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is great lens for the money! A noticeable improvement from my 14-150mm Olympus kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Zambito

customer_reviews.title: A lovely lens
customer_reviews.text: Just used this lens to take portraits at a local festival, and it was flawless. My customers were pleased and so was I. Easy to focus on the face and blur the background, so there is nothing to distract from the subject. Nice looking lens, solidly built. Very fine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: sharp, sharp, sharp
customer_reviews.text: I am just learning how to use the OMD e 5 after years of using most all of the Olympus DSLR cameras. This little lens is terrific! I took many photo's at a retirement party for a wounded warrior marine, some head shots and some of the crowd. I was blown away by the detail and color. Did not have to tweak hardly any of the photo's except for some cropping. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Anne Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: My favorite lens
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite lens I use. Great for portraits shots. I just love prime lens! It's a must have for all photographers.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M Robinson

customer_reviews.title: good optics
customer_reviews.text: Well made, small and good optics. I use this on the DJI Inspire X5 mount and so far so good. A bit of "jello" on the video but I'm learning to fix that with technique.
customer_reviews.author: Mark from LA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens... so small and compact, but beautifully constructed. Very sharp optics and you can get full-frame-esque DOF blur.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly small with great, clear pictures. This is the first prime lens I have owned (since my SLR days) and I realize how much I enjoy using this lens (in addition to the zoom lenses I own). Great for portraits and shooting around the town. Heck probably great for many styles of shooting, but I have only owned it for a few weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: PLD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: i am very happy with this lens. It is tack sharp, small, and compact. The build oozes quality, and the focus ring operates silky smooth. I am delighted with the pictures - especially portraits - that I am getting with this lens. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John McQuitty

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a GH5.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a GH5. Great lens, Good price to get the bokken effect. very specific focal range you will have to get used to. I Don't regret!
customer_reviews.author: Cole dba Master Productions

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best lens for the size and price. Great on the streets, in low light and for portraits.
customer_reviews.author: Corban Lundborg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a significant difference in the kit lens vs this lens for portraits. The pictures are coming out amazing
customer_reviews.author: Shock Surplus

customer_reviews.title: A great lens, fun to play with
customer_reviews.text: Every review you have read is true. I give it four stars due to soft corners at low apertures and some chromatic aberration although not as noticeable as with my Pana 20mm pancake. Otherwise it is fast to focus and sharp,
customer_reviews.author: STO

customer_reviews.title: Super Image Quality
customer_reviews.text: My first review of anything on Amazon.com, long story short I use this on Panasonic G7 hence to be fair the autofocus is not that great but image quality is outstanding , superb colors , so good that I am thinking of moving to Olympus M4/3 body like an OMD series for getting bette autofocus and in body stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Sangya D.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little lens
customer_reviews.text: This portrait lens is a tiny little wonder. A fraction of the size of full frame portrait lenses, it delivers sharp images with great bokeh and a satisfying depth of field. It will also fit neatly in your camera bag, giving you the option to take it along with you just about everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, fast portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: At f/1.8, this is among the faster lenses for micro four-thirds photographers. With a shallow depth-of-field at the wide-open apertures, it gives you that characteristic background blur that makes portraits jump out. At $400 as of November 2012, it isn't cheap, but it's one of the best lenses made for micro four-thirds. One thing to note: the 45mm focal length requires a fair bit of distance between the photographer and the subject. In small indoor rooms, you may not be able to back up enough to get the shot you want.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Good for m43 photography, seek other options for video
customer_reviews.text: Good picture quality, prefer this to the Voightlander m43 45mm f0.95 portrait lens due to the price difference v image quality differentials. wide open on the Voight is almost unusable (for me) due to its incredibly shallow DOF. If you are shooting video, suggest instead grabbing a good quality Canon FD 50mm f1.4 or Nikkor equivalent with speed booster instead. This lens can cause some pretty bad moire in certain situations when shooting video whereas the previously mentioned vintage lenses will not. DOF is super shallow wide open which can provide some good bokeh, just be sure to use that ultra zoom to set focus properly as it can fall in and out of tack sharpness easily when shooting handheld.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp but lacking some interest.
customer_reviews.text: While I love the way this lens handles, focuses, and is sharp... it lacks something intangible. The bokeh is not bad, but not tremendous either. Overall, a great deal for such a competent lens. I would take it over my Nikon 85/1.8g
customer_reviews.author: Dwegs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens takes great photos. I am using it with the Olympus OMD-E5 camera and it is very fast and does not require a flash even it very low lit areas. The construction seems very sturdy yet it is unbelievable how light it is. Love this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Smuffins

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this lens for my OM-D E-M5. (and I would recommend buying over the 14-42mm kit lens or Panasonic 7-14mm f/4.0)
customer_reviews.text: It is simply impossible to take a bad picture with this lens. If I had to do it again, I'd have gotten this before my Panasonic 7-14mm f/4.0 wide angle lens (which is also brilliant) and the 14-42mm kit lens that came with my OM-D.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Snow

customer_reviews.title: Awesomely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a portrait lens, and I got it just before birth of my first son, this lens produces amazingly beautiful pictures of landscapes. Used this lens during Grand Canyon trip, and I must say - epm1 with this lens beats any entry level and most mid-range DSLRs.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: The one lens to get for your micro 4/3rd setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens along with the OM-D body and if there were one lens to get with your micro 4/3rds camera. I use this as a daily walkaround lens and it extremely sharp and super fast. Olympus 45mm - performs incredibly well under all aperture settings. With the noise filter turned off and at ISO 200, the details that this lens captures is just out of the world. The autofocus on this lens is superfast and it was really quick to pick up focus, at pin-point accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: V Ram

customer_reviews.title: Best Micro Four Thirds Lens I've Used
customer_reviews.text: Best Micro Four Thirds lens I've used. Finds focus fast, works great in low light. A really nice bokeh when used wide open. The worst part is since M 4/3 doubles lens length, the 35mm equivalent is 90mm which can be hard to work with in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: El Duderino

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Nice portrait and close up shots. Great fit to my Panasonic camera.
customer_reviews.author: Journo

customer_reviews.title: Near silent AF and well formed Bokeh. The lens ...
customer_reviews.text: Near silent AF and well formed Bokeh. The lens is much sharper than the 12mm-50mm kit provided for the OM-D EM5 and a little more than half its size. Solid build with a metal mount.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lens; works perfectly for my line of work ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lens; works perfectly for my line of work where I take photos for research (I use the design thinking/human-centered design method where participant observation and conceptual inquiry forms a big part of my work), and I need a quick, reliable, and solid way to take photos of customers 'in the moment'. Kevin (seller) was phenomenal - shipment was way faster than expected, and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Sook Jin Ong

customer_reviews.title: Best lens i have ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to believe how good pictures this lens takes. Price is very good. I have Zuiko 12mm f2.0 too and this lens takes sharper pictures than my 12mm and is half the price. Focusing is fast & quiet. You would get amazing Bokeh with this lens. There are 2 negatives. 1) lens is not great for shooting video in closer range. It does lot of focus hunting in closer distance. I have 4 year old so to shoot video i keep 12mm which does a great job in video. 2) It's not metal. so you gotta be careful. Overall, I highly recommend this lens. It's must have lens and you will love the pictures it takes.
customer_reviews.author: R. R

customer_reviews.title: Oly m4/3 45mm f/1.8
customer_reviews.text: An excellent lens. Works great in low light conditions (the reason I purchased it), and is the perfect lens for inconspicuous use in lecture, presentation, conference situations (I don't do portraits :).
customer_reviews.author: Stonehollow

customer_reviews.title: Great refurbish quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a refurbished lens here and I'm so happy that it works well as if it's new!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Fast, good quality
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good lens. Unfortunately I couldn't use it for all I wanted as it has far more zoom than I expected however that is because of my lack of photography knowledge. I used it for some pictures in the dark and it was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I've just recently switched over from a Canon to the Olympus. When I did I knew this needed to be the first lens I would add to my bag. It have not disappointed in the least. The lens is crisp, fast and small. An absolute must for an affordable lens to get all those amazing portrait pictures you've been dreaming of.
customer_reviews.author: smj018

customer_reviews.title: Good for portraiture.
customer_reviews.text: Still need to buy a viewfinder for use in daylight.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee Hatchett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great portrait lens. Shame it is sold without a hood, that I bought separately.
customer_reviews.author: Mandelblat Julius

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens. I am using this with E-PL3 and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens. I am using this with E-PL3 and get fantastic results. so much so that this has become my primary lens. The bokeh is excellent. Will post pics soon.
customer_reviews.author: Manish Acharya

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Excelent quality and performance for the price. Lens is a little hard to twist in the E-PM2.Highly recommended for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Willem

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The lens to be very good value for money. Images appear sharp which is great. Not too expensive either.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Railton

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, beautiful photos
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens with a Panasonic GF2 camera, mainly for portrait shots. It takes beautiful sharp photos with a nice, shallow depth of field. It excels at outdoor portraits. I was shocked by how much different (and better) the photos from this lens are than the ones with my 20MM and kit lenses. Although the lens lets in plenty of light for indoor photography, its only drawback is a function of the crop factor - you have to stand pretty far back from your subject to get the shot. This makes things challenging trying to get great shots inside the house. Plan for a lot of close-ups!
customer_reviews.author: Reid Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome the little lense
customer_reviews.text: I usually purchase kit lens with the camera. Thus does not know how this little lens will perform. i have read extensively about this and decided to buy it. What a nice little lens!! Anyone who saw it, was impressed by its quality - especially in low light shooting. There was a flash provided with the Olympus - D M5 but I guess I would never have use it. that would be less stuff to tote around
customer_reviews.author: segovia1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite lens. The pictures and portraits that come out of it are absolutely stunning. I would recommend this lens without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: C. Frey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love! Love! Love! I bought a used one and it was just perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with focus in video mode
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens mainly for my vlog and YouTube channel. In picture mode the lens have good response but I use it mainly for video recording and auto focusing is very poor. Since I have to record motion of myself I can’t use manual focusing or peaking. I basically need to have a second person or get another lens.
customer_reviews.author: HYoung

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite lenses
customer_reviews.text: Crisp images. Handles low light well. Great for portraits and general photography. Sold me on micro four thirds. Went from EPL1 to EM5 and EM1. Getting rave reviews on my photography with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Amazing portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens, I use it all the time. The color and clarity are exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: TallOne

customer_reviews.title: great lens
customer_reviews.text: awesome portrait lens! Extremely sharp with great color rendition. wish it wasn't plastic, but very satisfied overall.
customer_reviews.author: Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: First rate lens...very sharp photos...love it. Exceeded all my expectations....would strongly recommend for any micro four thirds camera owners. So far I can't find anything I dislike about the lens.
customer_reviews.author: aharnisch

customer_reviews.title: A very sweet little lens
customer_reviews.text: Simply delicious images. Crystal sharp focus and gently soft out of focus. Wonderfully compact for any MFT body size, even the Panasonic GM1. Minus 1 star for no included hood, Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens and perfect for portraits. The focus is sharp and the field of depth is phenomenal. I would recommend it to any professional photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Good as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Fast,very good resolution, reliable color rendition, surprisingly light in weight. If you need that focal length, just buy it. Will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Kamakea

customer_reviews.title: Great for taking portraits
customer_reviews.text: It creates very nice skin tone in portraits, especially at lower light settings.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D

customer_reviews.title: Amazing grace
customer_reviews.text: A spectacular lens in an unbelievably small, light, and affordable package. One of the best portrait lenses around. Don't miss it.
customer_reviews.author: Eolake

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far this is my favorite lens for the micro four thirds system.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro

customer_reviews.title: A fine lens
customer_reviews.text: Great portrait lens. Very sharp. Nice and light. One of my favs.
customer_reviews.author: SamIam

customer_reviews.title: Great Low Light Lens
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this lens for a couple of days now, but I've been very happy with the performance so far. I used it for some simple low light (didn't want to use a flash) family photos and also some indoor youth basketball games. The basketball photos were really good because I could bump up the speed to freeze the action. I had been using the 40-150 zoom for sports, but I had to use a lower speed and a lot of the action blurred indoors. With this lens on my Oly OM-D I'm able to take really good indoor sports photos. Something I've never been able to do. I'm looking forward to using this lens more.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: great small lens
customer_reviews.text: light, small, fast, clear...a great little lens for mft camera. it is plastic but you wouldnt know it. i have an olympus omd and it works great w/ it
customer_reviews.author: bhd

customer_reviews.title: Great Portrait Lens!  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for portraits and indoor use. Less shadowing when taking candid photos and using the attached flash! I am looking forward to using it outside come Spring and Summer for the blurred affect.
customer_reviews.author: P Lynn Hall

customer_reviews.title: This lens is fantastic. Portraits
customer_reviews.text: This lens is fantastic. Portraits, flowers, etc. It focuses perfectly, and control of depth of field is great. I use it with an Oly OMD em5 Mark II
customer_reviews.author: Natureie

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go along with the Olympus OM-D. Very sharp, fast focusing. I love the retro silver look and the small size. I can't get over what a perfect size the micro 4/3's camera and lenses are. I highly recommend switching from DSLR to the Olympus or any of the better Micro 4/3's cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cottle

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this lens
customer_reviews.text: I have just begun to get into photography and I am very pleased with this lens. Takes amazing photos and I am sure will take even better photos once I gain more knowledge about photography.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Sharp beautiful lens for cheap. Feels very close in though. I'd start with the 25.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Can't add any more than has already been said about this lens but if you like the 90mm focal length this is the lens for micro 4/3.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great lens, does exactly what it is supposed to do. And it's durable as it survived a drop to the floor by my husband who should stay out of my camera case.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kruegel

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box it felt a little cheap, plastic build. Not built anything like my Panny 12-35mm or 35-100mm. Ok that being said it didn't cost as much as those two either. I only had a few minutes to take some shots with it but the pictures came out out SUPERB!!! I have a MPWA wrestling event in which the lighting will be on the dim side and that should provide an adequate test for the Oly 45mm 1.8 lens. I will update after the event. But so far I love the picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lens Awesome Value
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing portrait lens and an even more amazing value! It is extremely fast and delivers crist images even withe wide open aperture. Does a good job in low light as well and produces great bokeh.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos E. Ribero

customer_reviews.title: Great portrait lens for micro 4/3rds!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for micro 4/3rds. Sharp, fast and light. One of the sharpest lenses in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adamo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the best lens I have for this camera I really like it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This lens is perfect for my travels because I take a lot of street photography and want the blur that DSLRs have. I am a super amateur but the lens really makes me feel like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Chen

customer_reviews.title: ¿No puedo calificar con más estrellas? I can not qualify with more stars?
customer_reviews.text: Este objetivo es el sueño de todo usuario de cámaras m4/3. Simplemente comprenlo. Jamás se arrepentirán. This objective is the dream of every user of cameras m4 / 3. Just buy it. Never regret.
customer_reviews.author: MRMD

customer_reviews.title: SHARP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this lens... At 90mm (35mm eq) it's the perfect portrait lens and it's light. I usually keep it in my pocket so I don't have to carry a bag. If you shoot micro 4/3rds I definitely recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Sverdlik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens.
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this lens. Works well alongside the 20mm and 14mm for a near perfect kit of primes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my DJI Inspire 1 Pro with the X5 camera. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Windham

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: My lens came in super condition, works brilliantly! Great for shooting all my blog photos with.
customer_reviews.author: Savvynista

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly small. Beautiful Images.
customer_reviews.text: The lens is smaller than I anticipated- it looks great on my silver Lumix GH-2. The images are sharp and rich- great color rendition typical of Olympus lenses. Tack sharp. I find that I like to use it at f4 for most subjects- because wide open the DOF may be too shallow for many shots. As others have said, optically it is superb. Do miss a lens shade though!
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Wowie!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely in love with this lens! Sharp! Clear! Quick focus. Beautiful bokeh! So happy I ordered it for my new Olympus OM-D
customer_reviews.author: ShirlJ

customer_reviews.title: Tiny package Big Image Quality
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to imagine a lens of this quality 45mm (90mm equivalent) and f/1.8 in nthe full frame Canon or Nikon world weight and sizing like this beaut! And the cost would be at least 2X. That's why I traded my Cano full frame gear for a Olympus EM1 where the stabilization in in the body - hence the lens are small, less expensive and the $'s spent are for image quality!
customer_reviews.author: Robert c gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: About all I can say bad would be "wish it was metal" but the pics it takes on an Olympus OM-D E-M5 are great. I haven't tried a better lens at a similar or lower price. Gives just the right amount of zoom and focus range with the 2x multiplier of the MFT format for every day use in action shots, such as pictures of a puppy playing a few feet away, without needing a flash.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

product_meta.title: Olympus V311030BU000 M.ZUIKO Digital ED 45mm F1.8 Lens for E Series DSLR Cameras
product_meta.description: Colour Name:Silver| Style Name:45mmUn design unique et un prix abordable, cet objectif complètera admirablement votre matériel photo. La rapidité d'ouverture permet de prendre des portraits parfaits avec des arrières plans contrastés. Compatible vidéo, il permet de réaliser des vidéos avec une mise au point très rapide. Il est possible d'adapter des bagues interchangeables de décoration aux couleurs des différents boîtiers Olympus PEN.
feature_bullets: Maximum f1.8 aperture, great for low light
f/1.8 maximum aperture delivers beautiful defocused backgrounds
Quiet Movie-Still-Compatible lens drive for video shooting
Optional LH-40B lens hood for shooting in bright conditions
